page.title: 09ONGAR'S SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content: The Ongar{Civic Trust}is agreed on the need for a{by-pass.}There are two possible routes. One lies to the east for easy access to LECA ,a works to the south east of Ongar which produces materials to make concrete.The western by-pass would run along the banks of the Cripsey brook. Some members of the Civic Trust are concerned that the land to the east of Ongar has good ammenity value and would be seriously scarred by an eastern by-pass.It would cut through the river Roding at some point and the present estates on the eastern side of Ongar. People favour the western route because it would reduce congestion in the High Street and allow development of blighted land behind the High Street for parking and residential / light industrial use.
